meanings.definition: To remove a saddle from a horse.
meanings.sent1: After the ride, the cowboy unsaddles the horse gently.
meanings.sent2: She always unsaddles her horse before brushing it.
meanings.sent3: The horse felt free when the cowboy unsaddles it.
meanings.sent4: As the saddle comes off, the horse's load unsaddles with it.
meanings.sent5: The act of unsaddling symbolizes the end of the journey for the horse.

meanings.definition: To relieve someone of a burden or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: He unsaddles his friend by taking on the extra work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher unsaddles the students by explaining the lesson clearly.
meanings.sent3: The offer to help unsaddles her from the stress of the project.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty unsaddles him from the guilt he was carrying.
meanings.sent5: A kind gesture can unsaddle someone from their worries.
